wikipedia_page.main: John Frederick Loverseed (22 December 1881 – 14 August 1928) was a British Liberal politician.

link_mentions.page: List of MPs elected in the 1923 United Kingdom general election

response: He was elected at the 1924 general election as Member of Parliament (MP) for the Sudbury constituency in Suffolk,  with a majority of 1 over the sitting Liberal MP John Frederick Loverseed.

Mercer was returned as the Member of Parliament for the Sudbury Division of Suffolk for the 1922 general election. He lost the seat in the 1923 election to Liberal politician John Frederick Loverseed.
